newsitem.title: ITALY: Fiat shares open nearly four percent up.
newsitem.headline: Fiat shares open nearly four percent up.

text.p: Shares in Italian carmaker Fiat began 3.77 percent higher at 4,515 lire in Milan on Tuesday following a government decision to provide incentives to car buyers and stimulate the flagging car sector.

The Italian cabinet approved measures after the market closed on Monday to provide a contribution to the car sector which would be passed on to clients in the form of a discount for those buying new cars and scrapping models older than 10 years.
The measure, which is part of decree linked to the 1997 budget, still has to be approved by parliament.
